intro: [WRONG START] Trigonella aurantiica var. pallida, commonly known as the pale bitter vetch, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing annual legume characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
